oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Clouds. Preparations to be made for the coming rain; the springbok to be watched for, etc. (L VIII.-23. 8018-8029). Jackal clouds are rain-clouds and are black. The people prepare their houses for a downpour, the men bringing bushes and the women 'making nice' the house so that they will not get wet. 1) p.8017v: |han=kass'o saw this happen; what the husband and wife say to each other, 2) p.8018v: |xam names for clouds, 3) p.8019v: (26 November 1878) on clouds (called 'rain's hair' or !kuagen and !kuita), 4) This story is found in Book VIII-23.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jackal clouds
